Nvm... I can\'t run it on my IP address. Halp? If not, it has to be hamachi. And whats so bd about hamachi anyway?!

Nvm... I can\'t run it on my IP address. Halp? If not, it has to be hamachi. And whats so bd about hamachi anyway?!

For me, it\'s just too much trouble.

You can host it natively with the Server version from minecraft.net as long as you forward your ports correctly. Look up a couple tuts on YT if you\'re having trouble.
Port forwarding is a huge PITA, that\'s why people use Hamachi.

KSP minecraft server aside, i\'ve been looking for a good server to play one (not creative) that is private and doesn\'t have too many rules (i\'m not a greifer, i just want to be able to use/play with everything).

~ash
Damn you Opengl error! >

I\'d recommend

Muttsworld. It\'s my personal favorite. I frequent it a lot; my IGN is Candre. ~100 players at any given time.

im confused

whats the adress of the server?

Port forwarding is a huge PITA, that\'s why people use Hamachi.

Port forwarding is as easy as making explosions in KSP.

You could always just set up a dedicated server on an Amazon EC-2 instance! It really isn\'t all that hard to do, you just have to know how to use Linux (cheaper than Windows).

At least it makes port forwarding easier, given you have total control of the ports opened and closed... =P

OP: you are running a legal version of the thing, aren\'t you?
